Kural_Info.Chapter: மன்னரைச் சேர்ந்தொழுதல் (Conduct in the Presence of the King)
Kural_Info.Tamil_Text: எப்பொருளும் ஓரார் தொடரார்மற் றப்பொருளை விட்டக்கால் கேட்க மறை.
Kural_Info.English_Meaning: Seek not, ask not, the secret of the king to hear; But if he lets the matter forth, give ear!.

Layered_Composition.Foreground: A king is discussing a secret matter ('மறை') with one minister. Another minister is standing nearby, respectfully.
Layered_Composition.Midground: This respectful minister is shown actively not listening; their ears are symbolically covered, and they are not trying to overhear or follow up on the secret conversation ('ஓரார் தொடரார்').
Layered_Composition.Background: Later, the king himself chooses to reveal the secret ('விட்டக்கால்') to the respectful minister. At this point, the minister's ears are shown to be open and receptive, listening intently ('கேட்க').

Art_Direction.Subject_and_Action: The proper conduct regarding a ruler's secrets is to make no effort to learn them, but to listen carefully if the ruler chooses to reveal them.
Art_Direction.Symbolic_Motifs: The symbolically covered and then uncovered ears represent the two phases of proper conduct: not prying, but being ready to listen.
Art_Direction.Lighting_and_Color: A formal, regal lighting. The secret conversation can be surrounded by a subtle aura of privacy. The final act of listening is shown as a moment of trust.

Technical_Cues.Camera: A two-part narrative image, showing the minister first respectfully ignoring the secret, and then respectfully receiving it.
Technical_Cues.Resolution: 8K, with a focus on the body language of discretion and respect.

Cultural_Anchors: Listening when it is revealed ('விட்டக்கால் கேட்க')

Negative_Prompt: minister eavesdropping, king getting angry, text artifacts.

Hyperparameters.seed: Explore variations for the aura of privacy.
